name: Magic School

story.title: The Fractured Second
story.logline: A clumsy student at an elite magic academy must ruin her own reputation to stop a deadly explosion she foresaw, all while hiding the forbidden ability that predicts the future.
story.target_audience: Young Adult (15-25), fans of magical school tropes with a psychological twist
story.synopsis:
Elara Vance is known as the 'Walking Disaster' of Aethelgard Academy. She trips over nothing, drops potions, and answers questions before teachers ask them. But Elara isn't clumsy; she is cursed with 'Chronos Sight,' seeing ten seconds into the future. She lives in a disorienting double-vision world where she must dodge debris that hasn't fallen yet. In a society where Prophets are imprisoned as unstable weapons, she plays the fool to survive.

The story takes place during the high-stakes Midterm Alchemy Exam. Elara has a terrifying vision: the star student, Kaelen, is going to add the wrong ingredient, causing a chain reaction that destroys the wing and kills him. Elara has one hour to sabotage the exam and prevent the disaster. Every attempt she makes to intervene subtly is thwarted by Kaelen's perfectionism and the strict proctor. As the clock ticks down to the fatal moment, Elara realizes she can't save him without using magic that will expose her secret identity. She must choose between her safety and her rival's life.

story_beats.description: OPENING PANEL: Extreme close-up of a coffee mug shattering on the floor. NEXT PANEL: Elara catches the mug in mid-air *before* it falls. She looks terrified, realizes she reacted too fast, and deliberately drops it to maintain her cover. Caption: 'I saw it break ten seconds ago.'

In the Alchemy Lab, Professor Thorne unveils the 'Volatile Phoenix Ash' for the midterm. Elara touches the jar and is hit with a violent vision: Green fire, Kaelen screaming, the clock tower crumbling. She snaps back to reality, gasping. The exam begins now.

Elara tries to steal Kaelen's ingredients to stop him, but he catches her and humiliates her for being 'incompetent.' She tries to spill water on his burner, but he blocks it with a shield spell. The class laughs. The clock ticks closer to the vision's timestamp. The tension rises as Kaelen reaches for the catalyst ingredient.

Kaelen holds the catalyst. In Elara's vision, the explosion happens NOW. She abandons subtlety. She sprints across the room, tackling Kaelen. As they fall, she instinctively casts a 'Stasis Bubble'—high-level forbidden magic—to contain the reaction of the dropped vial. The vial explodes silently inside the bubble, mere inches from their faces.

The smoke clears. Elara plays it off as a clumsy fall that luckily knocked the vial away. The Professor buys it, scolding her for running. But as Elara walks away, shaking, Kaelen grabs her wrist. He looks at the remnants of the high-level Stasis spell fading on the floor, then at her. 'You didn't trip,' he whispers. Cliffhanger: Elara's secret is compromised.

chapters.title: The Fractured Second
chapters.summary: Elara Vance tries to survive a potions class without revealing her forbidden foresight, but a reflex action draws the suspicion of the class prodigy, Kaelen Vross.

scenes.description: A cramped circular room filled with green haze. Bubbling beakers and scratching quills dominate the soundscape.

panels.action: A ceramic mug hits the stone floor and shatters into jagged pieces. Coffee splashes in a violent, frozen arc. The colors are slightly inverted/distorted to indicate a vision.
panels.continuity_note: This is a vision of the immediate future.

panels.action: Return to reality. Kaelen, looking annoyed, abruptly turns to grab an ingredient, his elbow swinging back toward Elara's mug sitting on the desk edge. The mug hasn't fallen yet.
In a blur of motion, Elara's hand snaps out. She catches the mug in mid-air just as Kaelen's elbow makes contact, preventing it from even wobbling. Her eyes are wide, pupils dilated.
panels.continuity_note: Elara's movement should look unnaturally fast, almost blurred.

panels.action: Time seems to freeze. Kaelen stares at her hand. Professor Thorne looks up from his desk, eyes narrowing. Elara freezes, sweat forming on her brow.

dialogue.text: (Too fast. I moved too fast. They saw.)

panels.action: Elara deliberately opens her fingers. The mug falls from her hand to the floor.
panels.continuity_note: Focus on the hand releasing the object.

panels.action: Thorne towers over them, shadow cast across Elara. Elara puts on a fake, ditzy smile, scratching the back of her head. Kaelen is wiping coffee off his pristine robes, looking furious.

dialogue.text: MISS VANCE! Detentions. For a week.
I saw it break ten seconds ago.

scenes.description: A massive open space with a glass ceiling showing the sky. Gears turn slowly in the walls.

panels.action: Elara sits on a bench, looking exhausted. Mimi is aggressively scrubbing a coffee stain out of Elara's sleeve with a glowing handkerchief.

dialogue.text: Honestly, El! How do you even manage to trip while standing still?
It's a gift, Mimi. A curse, really.

panels.continuity_note: Bright, airy lighting contrasts the previous dark lab.

panels.action: A shadow falls over them. Kaelen stands there, arms crossed, looking down at Elara. He ignores Mimi completely.
Elara forces a confused laugh, waving her hands dismissively. She leans back, trying to look casual.

dialogue.text: Caught what? A cold? Hopefully not, I can't afford more sick days.

panels.action: Focus on Kaelen's eyes. They are sharp, analytical. He isn't buying it.

dialogue.text: The mug. You caught it before I even hit it. No one has reflexes like that. Not even a combat mage.

panels.action: Elara stands up, grabbing Mimi by the arm to drag her away. She turns her back to Kaelen, waving over her shoulder.

dialogue.text: It was just a flail, Kael! A lucky, clumsy flail. See you in History!
Wait, my cleaning spell isn't done!

panels.action: Kaelen remains alone in the frame, watching them leave. He looks at his own elbow, then back at Elara's retreating figure. The background gears seem to frame him like a cage.

scenes.description: Tiny, cluttered room. Every surface is covered in talismans and notes. It feels like a bunker.

panels.action: Elara collapses onto her bed, face in the pillow. The room is dark, lit only by moonlight.
Elara rolls over, staring at the ceiling. She looks exhausted, the 'clumsy' mask completely gone. Her eyes are hauntingly sad.

dialogue.text: If Kael figures it out, I'm expelled. Or worse.

panels.action: Elara's pupil suddenly constricts. A violet light flares in her iris. A migraine strikes.
VISION PANEL: The Alchemy Lab is engulfed in blue fire. The walls are blown out. Students are screaming. The colors are inverted and jagged.
panels.continuity_note: This is a vision of the future.

panels.action: VISION PANEL: Close up on Kaelen lying in the rubble, unmoving. A cracked pocket watch lies next to his hand.
Elara shoots up in bed, gasping for air, clutching her chest. She is back in her dark room, terrified.

dialogue.text: No... not the lab. Not him.

original_prompt: A young witch discovers she has a rare ability to see the future, but must keep it secret from her classmates at the magical academy.
